title: Poor diagnostics for [T, N] turbofish instead of [T; N]

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Minimal example:

```rust
fn main() {
    drop::<[(), 0]>([]);
}
```

([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=4f71238582d5427dafcae07a57f66b0a))

Errors:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error: unmatched angle bracket
 --> src/main.rs:2:11
  |
2 |     drop::<[(), 0]>([]);
  |           ^ help: remove extra angle bracket

error: expected one of `;` or `]`, found `,`
 --> src/main.rs:2:15
  |
2 |     drop::<[(), 0]>([]);
  |               ^ expected one of `;` or `]`

error: aborting due to 2 previous errors

error: could not compile `playground`

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.

```

Here, there actually isn't an unmatched angle bracket; the issue is that `[(), 0]` isn't a type, and that it should be `[(); 0]`. There might be other cases where this mistake causes awkward errors that might need fixing too, but this is just what I found.
